sub_title: MSCActions PhD fellow of ETN PALAMUSTO (Palace Museum of Tomorrow) at Utrecht University
summary:
Art historian specialized in 16th-18th and 19th-20th century social history of art and architecture. Keen on realizing and curating of pernament and temporary exhibitions. Extremely interested in digital and interactive storytelling/gamification in Cultural Heritage.

I have graduated from the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens (department of History and Archaeology-specialization in Archaeology and History of Art). In 2014, I was accepted in Paris 1 Panthéon-Sorbonne (Department of Archaeology and History of Art) as an erasmus student. In 2017 I completed my postgraduate studies at the University of St Andrews in Scotland (School of Art History). Below you can find a sample of my working experience:

I am a PhD fellow of PALAMUSTO (Research and Training for the Palace Museum of Tomorrow-Horizon 2020- Marie Skłodowska-Curie ITN fellowship) at Utrecht University.
Project: The court chapel across religious boundaries
Analysing the religious space in the court residence in times of religious upheaval.

I completed my military service in the Floating Naval Museum Battleship "Georgios Averof". Main tasks: Tour guide, curating the pernament exhibition and the historical archive of the Ship, writing and editing press releases.

Programming and Production Intern at SNFCC (Stavros Niarchos Foundation Cultural Center) (June 2018-January 2019). Main tasks: Organizing, coordinating, curating, setting up and supervising cultural events such as music concerts, art exhibitions and workshops for kids and adults, public relations. 

Assistant Curator/Intern in Rebecca Camhi Gallery (January-June 2018). Main tasks:  Organizing, coordinating and setting up group and solo exhibitions, welcoming visitors and potential clients, using social media, writing and editing press releases, public relations and marketing. 
 
Email: manosvak@yahoo.com
